fulltext:
LÊ VĂN TIẾN PHÁT 
levantienphat1289@gmail.com | Mobile: (+84) 36 323 6001 |  
District 1, Ho Chi Minh, Vietnam  
SUMMARY 
• Two years’ experience working in 
project / program managing roles 
• Basic knowledge of Management 
Tools 
• Project Executive  
• Event Oriented/Organization 
• Problem-solving and Personal Assistant 
• Stakeholders Communication 
EDUCATION 
UNIVERSITY OF SCIENCE, VIETNAM NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HO CHI MINH CITY - 2013 – 2017 
• Major: Environmental Science and Management 
WORK EXPERIENCES   
Project Coordinator – The Open House (Toong Coworking Space) – Feb 2019 – Now 
Work closely with the General Managel and Business Development Manager to executive several projects. 
• Manage project correspondence, price tender, drawings, generate scopes of work base on division, 
award contracts, create schedules, maintain quality of work, and project financial allocation which 
is up to $600K 
• Coordinate experts of landowners, Interior fit out companies, Contractor to meet requirements and 
key deadlines. 
• Assist General Manager and Business Development Manager in numerous tasks to accomplish the 
critical commission. 
Project officer – Center of Hands on Actions and Networking for Growth and Environment (CHANGE) – 
Oct 2017 – Feb 2019 
Working under the Project Manager of the Climate Change Department to several executive projects in 
different fields. 
• Organize the youth training course, named “Vietnam Climate Leadership Camp” which nearly 80 
participants from several provinces in Viet Nam about environmental knowledge and soft skills. 
• Working with suppliers/ partners/ allies and volunteers to implement fruitful projects such as event, 
workshop, competitions, training. 
• Assist Project Manager in numerous reasonable tasks to accomplish the routine basis. 
Internship / Assistant Project Manager - Center of Hands-on Actions and Networking for Growth and 
Environment (CHANGE) - Jul 2016 – Nov 2016.  
The project is informing the general public about ongoing environmental and social hazards at Vinh Tan 2 
coal plant in Vietnam.   
• Coordinated the research and production of communication documentaries.  
• Evaluate the pollution through the collected data and create the report. 
• Work with the community to spread the story about the impact of a thermal power plant 
Vietnam Recycles Project, Reverse Logistics Group Vietnam - Mar 2017 – June 2017.  
Vietnam Recycles is run by the Vietnam Recycling Platform (VRP), a consortium of leading producers of 
electrical and electronic equipment founded to reduce electronic waste. 
Assistant Project Director 
• Take main and direct responsibilities of supervising and evaluating the quality of Collection Point.    
• Coordinated with worker to maintain the facilities of collection point.  
• Report the service, personnel, infrastructure, user’ experiences in the site 
EXTRACURRICULAR ACTIVITIES 
Facilitator - Civil society meets renewable energy and energy efficiency (E-Enhance) - GreenID Vietnam & 
EU - Nov 2018 – Now. 
• Collaborate and facilitate the training for rural citizen about using Renewable Energy 
• Working with stakeholders and government departments to hold, collect, organize the participants 
for the training.   
President - Green Club, Faculty of Environment-University of Science - Nov 2013 – Aug 2016. 
• Lead, oriented and organize club which has 30 members 
• Working with partners and stakeholders to host events. 
Head of Organization Department - "Climate change and our action" Contest - Respond "UN Climate 
Change Conference - COP21”, Green Generation Network, Live & Learn Viet Nam – Nov 2015.  
• Managed the core team to organize the activities of the event.  
• Coordinated the stakeholders and production of contest content 
OTHERS 
“East Asia Climate Leadership Camp (EACLC)” Program, 350.org East Asia – Nov 2018. 
The program is established to serve as part of the East Asia Climate Leadership Program, which will be an 
offline training opportunity for partners in the region to learn and exchange campaign ideas to each other. 
“Sakura Exchange Program in Science 2017” Program, Japan Science and Technology Agency (JST) – Aug 
2017. 
The program enhances exchanges between Asia and Japan of the youths who will play a crucial role in the 
future field of science and technology by facilitating short-term visits to Japan. 
 “Be Change Agents” Training, Living and Learning Center for Environment and Community (LIVE & 
LEARN) – Sep 2014  
The program promotes the change agent role of young people in Vietnam for Understanding and Action for 
sustainable development and good Management 
REFERENCES 
Ms. Nguyen Duc Hanh 
Mr. Nguyen Dai Dung 
• Email: nguyenduchanh2289@gmail.com 
• Phone: 0988302483 
• Email: Ngddung253@gmail.com 
• Phone: 0902468020
